meanings.definition: The act of covering or obscuring something with fog.
meanings.sent1: The fogging over the city made it hard to see buildings.
meanings.sent2: The fogging in the forest created a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The fogging on my glasses made me look like a clumsy scientist.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a fogging mirror, reflecting nothing but confusion.
meanings.sent5: The fogging of the lake at dawn was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.sent1: The fogging in the valley happened as the temperature dropped.
meanings.sent2: The fogging on the window occurred when warm air met cold glass.
meanings.sent3: The fogging during the play made the scene look like a dream sequence.
meanings.sent4: The fogging of the mind can happen when trying to remember a distant memory.
meanings.sent5: The fogging of the landscape transformed the view into a mystical painting.

meanings.definition: The act of causing a surface to become covered in condensation.
meanings.sent1: The fogging on the mirror happened after a hot shower.
meanings.sent2: The fogging on the camera lens affected the quality of the photos.
meanings.sent3: The fogging on the window made it seem like a ghost had breathed on it.
meanings.sent4: Her glasses were fogging up from the warm soup she was eating.
meanings.sent5: The fogging on the glass made it difficult to see through.
